SEARCH
Package gw.api.financials

Class TransactionWizardHelper

java.lang.Object
gw.api.web.AbstractPageHelperImpl
gw.api.financials.TransactionWizardHelper
All Implemented Interfaces:
PageHelper
Direct Known Subclasses:
RecoveryReserveWizardHelper, ReserveWizardHelper
public abstract class TransactionWizardHelper extends AbstractPageHelperImpl
Parent class of the ReserveWizardHelper and RecoveryReserveWizardHelper.

Creates a new TransactionSet, and for each ReserveLine to be displayed on the screen, creates a new Transaction with that ReserveLine set, and wraps it in a TransactionEditWrapper to track any new amount entered by the user.

A change in the reserve line new amount column results in a new Transaction in the amount of the change, to adjust the reserve line to the new amount. All such Transactions are part of the same TransactionSet and are submitted together for approval.

      Holds a set of wrapper beans which contain the new value for each reserve in the reserve set This needs to be maintained internally so that Autosave and other things will work properly, and so that we can add new wrappers as we add new reserves

      protected Set<Key> _nonEditableIds
      Contains the IDs of Transactions displayed in the Wizard with only their New Amount field editable. All other transactions should be fully editable (except for obvious read-only fields like Exposure.PrimaryCoverage and Change Amount)

      protected abstract List<Transaction> findPendingApprovalTransactionsOnReserveLine(Transaction transaction)
      Retrieves the Reserves with status of Pending-Approval that are related to the indicated reserve. By related, it is meant that there is a match of Exposure, CostType and CostCategory.

      Returns:
      array of related pending-approval Reserve entities

      public TransactionSet getWorkingTransactionSet()
      The new TransactionSet any new Transactions belong to.

    • getTransactionWrappers

      public TransactionEditWrapper[] getTransactionWrappers()
      List of TransactionEditWrappers, which the LV displays. Each wrapper holds any new value entered by the user, and wraps a potential new Transaction on that reserve line. (The Transaction is really just a convenient way to hold the Exposure, CostType, CostCategory of the given reserve line.)

    • getFullyEditableTransactions

      public List<Transaction> getFullyEditableTransactions()
      Get IDs of transactions in working set that satisfy isTransactionFullyEditable.

      Removes a Transaction from the working TransactionSet.

    • removeTransaction

      public void removeTransaction(TransactionEditWrapper wrapperToRemove)
      Remove wrapper from LV and bundle, and remove transaction from bundle.

    • updateWrapperOnChangePost

      public void updateWrapperOnChangePost(TransactionEditWrapper wrapper)
      If the reserve line changes to one with a different base amount than that of the previously-selected reserve line, this resets TransactionEditWrapper's NewAmountInClaimCurrency to the "initial new value" for the new reserve line, which also sets its transaction amount to the same value and sets the transaction's currency back to the reserving currency. It uses the TransactionEditWrapper.PrevBaseAmount property to determine whether there was a change, and at the end of this method, it updates .PrevBaseAmount to the base amount for the new reserve line. This method doesn't touch the "NewAmount" properties or currency when there is no change in "initial new value" for the reserve line; in that case, the value entered by the user is considered to still be valid.

    • getInitialNewReservingAmount

      protected abstract IMoney getInitialNewReservingAmount(Transaction transaction)
      The initial amount displayed in the NewAmount column. i.e. Base+Pending or Base. Must not return null.

    • addNewTransaction

      Parameters:
      exposure - preset this exposure on the new transaction

    • isTransactionFullyEditable

      public boolean isTransactionFullyEditable(Transaction transaction)
      In the wizard, we only want to make fully editable those line-items that have no associated pending or available reserves, which is also the set we use to prepopulate the wizard. This method is used to test each row of the ELV to determine whether it should be fully editable. By "fully editable" it is meant that the Exposure, CostType and CostCategory will all be editable, as opposed to only the New Available Reserves (or New Total Incurred) field being editable.
      Returns:
      true if the Transaction should be fully editable in the Wizard, else false

    • getValidExposures

      public List<Exposure> getValidExposures(Transaction currentTransaction)
      Retrieve the list of valid exposures to display in the Exposure Picker for the given transaction while in the Reserve Wizard UI.
      Parameters:
      currentTransaction - contains Exposure, CostType, CostCategory, ReservingCurrency already selected.
      Returns:
      a List, possibly empty, containing Exposure beans superclass of that object

    • getValidCostTypes

      public List<CostType> getValidCostTypes(Transaction currentTransaction)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getCurrentCalculationReservingAmount

      protected IMoney getCurrentCalculationReservingAmount(Transaction transaction, FinancialsExpression expression)
      The value of the FinancialsExpression for the ReserveLine of the given Transaction in the reserving currency.
      Returns:
      the calculation value for the indicated Transaction's Exposure, CostType and CostCategory for the given financials expression in the reserving currency, or zero if the transaction's CostType or CostCategory are null or there are no matching reserve lines.

    • getSumForFinancialsExpression

      protected IMoney getSumForFinancialsExpression(FinancialsExpression expression)
      Call getCurrentCalculationReservingAmount() with the given FinancialsExpression across all transactions in the TransactionSet and return the sum of the ReservingAmounts, to display in the footer of a column.
      Returns:
      sum of given financialsExpression for all transactions in the LV in the claim currency, returns null if a ReserveLine's ReservingCurrency differs from the others

    • getNewAmountSum

      public BigDecimal getNewAmountSum()
      Adds up the NewReservingAmounts in the reserving currency for all the transaction wrappers in the LV for display in the footer. Returns null if any reserving currencies differ.

    • getChangeAmountSum

      public IMoney getChangeAmountSum()
      Adds up the ChangeReservingAmounts in the reserving currency for all the rows in the LV for display in the Change column footer. Returns null if there are no non-null ChangeReservingAmounts or any that have different currencies.

    • getChangeReservingAmount

      public IMoney getChangeReservingAmount(TransactionEditWrapper wrapper)
      Calculates the amount by which the user has changed the new reserving amount for the specified reserve line; returns null if no change has been made. The change is calculated as the difference between the "new amount" and the "base amount".
      Parameters:
      wrapper - the non-persistent entity used to track changes to reserves in the UI
      Returns:
      the difference between the newly entered transaction amount and the existing reserves in the reserving currency, or null if no change has been made

    • getChangeAmountPair

      public IPairedMoney getChangeAmountPair(TransactionEditWrapper wrapper)
      Calculates the amount by which the user has changed the new amount for the specified reserve line (in the transaction (primary) and claim (secondary) currencies); returns null if no change has been made. The change is calculated as the difference between the "new amount" and the "base amount".
      Parameters:
      wrapper - the non-persistent entity used to track changes to reserves in the UI
      Returns:
      the difference between the newly entered transaction amount and the existing reserves in the transaction and claim currencies, or null if no change has been made

    • removeOptionsThatCreateDuplicates

      protected static void removeOptionsThatCreateDuplicates(Collection<?> options, TransactionSet tSet, String propertyName, Exposure exposure, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory, RecoveryCategory recoveryCategory, Currency reservingCurrency)
      Given the set of already existing ReserveLines, as represented by the TransactionSet, remove the options for the given propertyName that would create duplicate ReserveLines.
      Parameters:
      options - set of options to examine
      propertyName - "Exposure", "CostType", "CostCategory", or "ReservingCurrency"
      exposure - already set Exposure
      costType - already set CostType
      costCategory - already set CostCategory
      reservingCurrency - already set ReservingCurrency

    • filterMatchingTransactions

      protected static List<Transaction> filterMatchingTransactions(TransactionSet tSet, String propertyName, Exposure exposure, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory, RecoveryCategory recoveryCategory, Currency reservingCurrency)
      Return the transactions that match the given exposure, costType, and costCategory, except for the value that corresponds to propertyName, which is ignored.
      Parameters:
      tSet - set of transactions to examine
      propertyName - "Exposure", "CostType", or "CostCategory". This field is ignored for matching.
      Returns:
      List of Transactions that match the other args.

      public static Set<?> getSetOfPropertyValues(Collection<?> list, String propertyName)
      Call the getter for the given propertyName on all the objects in the Collection.
      Parameters:
      list - any Collection
      Returns:
      Set of unique values assigned to the given property across all objects in the Collection.

    • getExistingReserveLines

      protected ReserveLine[] getExistingReserveLines(Claim claim, Exposure filteringExposure, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory, Currency reservingCurrency)
      builds the working set of Transactions by pulling out all ReserveLines that aren't designated to be ignored by the subclass.

    • ignoreReserveLine

      protected abstract boolean ignoreReserveLine(ReserveLine reserveLine, Exposure filteringExposure, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory, Currency reservingCurrency)

    • beforeCommit

      public void beforeCommit()
      Do work before commit to the database. Determine which values have been changed, so a new Transaction is created. Retires Pending Transactions which have been been superseded by changes, combining with the new Transaction. Allows explicitly setting 0 amount on a reserve line. Checks that a new TransactionSet is being created if a Document was added, since Documents are linked to the TransactionSet, not individual transactions.

    • beforeCommitWithoutRefreshingExposures

      public void beforeCommitWithoutRefreshingExposures()
      Do work before commit to the database. Determine which values have been changed, so a new Transaction is created. Retires Pending Transactions which have been been superseded by changes, combining with the new Transaction. Allows explicitly setting 0 amount on a reserve line. Checks that a new TransactionSet is being created if a Document was added, since Documents are linked to the TransactionSet, not individual transactions. Does not explicitly refresh the exposures.

    • haveSingleTransactionCurrency

      public static boolean haveSingleTransactionCurrency(List<Transaction> transactions)
      Checks if all the transactions share the same transaction currency
      Parameters:
      transactions - list of transactions
      Returns:
      true if all transactions share the same transaction currency, and false otherwise

    • haveSingleReservingCurrency

      public static boolean haveSingleReservingCurrency(List<Transaction> transactions)
      Checks if all the transactions share the same reserving currency
      Parameters:
      transactions - list of transactions
      Returns:
      true if all transactions share the same reserving currency, and false otherwise

    • getAmountForSumComputation

      public static IMoney getAmountForSumComputation(Transaction transaction, boolean parentListHasSingleReservingCurrency, boolean parentListHasSingleTransactionCurrency)
      Indicates the amount property that should be used to compute the sum total for all the transactions, which is displayed in the Transaction's LV footer.
